New Records: Rachin Ravindra made an unbeaten century on his World Cup debut for New Zealand
Devon Conway scored a rapid unbeaten century
All 11 England batters made double figures, the first time in ODIs
Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra's rapid centuries set up New Zealand's victory
England struggled to form partnerships despite a strong batting lineup
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand's bowlers restricted England to a modest total of 9-282
England captain Jos Buttler indicated the loss was tough but not too concerning
Post-Match Reflections: Rachin Ravindra's debut and performance were praised by New Zealand's team
Jos Buttler expressed disappointment but remained focused for the rest of the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand achieved a high run rate victory
England's performance marked a historical first
